page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: In June 1985 in an area between South{Wilford}Endowed School and Wilford Meadows School, we found wild strawberries, bramble, common vetch, purple clover and wild carrot growing in a section of railway embankment. Magpies were constantly to be seen and many pairs of blackbirds. Thrushes and other seed eating birds like linnets and greenfinches were around too. Old allotments bordering the embankments had reverted to pasture for horses and ponies. Within the Wilford Meadows playing fields were cuckoo pint, sorrel, buttercups and grasses, which indicate an old, undisturbed meadow. Between the playing fields and the marshland, the variety of vegetation provides a habitat for all kinds of birds and wild life.
